prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation or translation. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. 3. Create a rectangle using the following lines: - Line 1: Starting point (0, 0), End point (0.5, 0) - Line 2: Starting point (0.5, 0), End point (0.5, 0.75) - Line 3: Starting point (0.5, 0.75), End point (0, 0.75) - Line 4: Starting point (0, 0.75), End point (0, 0) 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles (0, 0, 0) and translation vector (0, 0, 0). 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.3 units towards the normal. Part 2: Cutout for the cylindrical hole Create a cutout for the cylindrical hole in the prism. The cutout has a flat base and a triangular top, connected by a straight line. 1. Define a new coordinate system at (0, 0, 0.3) with no rotation. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. 3. Create a triangle using the following lines: - Line 1: Starting point (0, 0), End point (0.15, 0) - Line 2: Starting point (0.15, 0), End point (0.15, 0.75) - Line 3: Starting point (0.15, 0.75), End point (0, 0.75) - Line 4: Starting point (0, 0.75), End point (0, 0) 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles (0, 0, 0) and translation vector (0, 0, 0). 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.15 units opposite the normal. Part 3: Cylindrical hole Create a cylindrical hole in the prism at an angle. 1. Define a new coordinate system at (0.225, 0.275, 0.3) with no rotation. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. 3. Create a circle with a center at (0.1, 0.1) and a radius of 0.1. 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.2. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles (0, 0, 0) and translation vector (0, 0, 0). 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 1.25 units opposite the normal. These instructions will result in a final shape that is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom, and the hole is located in the center of the prism. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 3 units by 2 units by 1 unit. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of about 0.5 units. The prism is positioned at an angle to the viewer.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism The first part of the CAD assembly is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Step 1: Create a Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Configure the Euler Angles to the following values: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and set the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.004, 0.0]. Step 2: Draw a 2D Sketch on the X-Y Plane Using the newly created coordinate system, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. Step 3: Create a Rectangle in the Sketch Create a rectangle in the sketch with the following dimensions: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.6742] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.6742], End Point [0.0, 0.6742] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.6742], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The rectangle should be closed, meaning that the start and end points of each line should connect. Step 4: Scale the Sketch Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. This will ensure that the dimensions of the prism are accurate. Step 5: Transform the Sketch into a 3D Sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the rotation and translation properties from the coordinate system. Step 6: Extrude the Sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the z-axis by a distance of 0.004 units to create a three-dimensional rectangular prism. This will result in a final shape that is 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Step 7: Set the Operation Set the operation to "NewBodyFeatureOperation". This will serve as the base for any subsequent parts that are added to the model. Step 8: Check the Dimensions Confirm that the part has the correct dimensions: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.004 * Height: 0.75</description>
